;In 2019, police officer Wang Shouyue retired in Guangdong. His colleagues celebrated him. At the dinner, he thought of the unsolved cases and the uncaught people, and he felt depressed.

;

;Wang Shouyue read the news about a fire somewhere in Yunnan on his mobile phone. There was a very familiar face among the passersby. He was sure that it was Chen Xinwen, the main suspect who robbed a cash transport truck and killed his police colleague more than 20 years ago. . Wearing casual clothes, he embarked on the journey alone, carrying a bag of fruit to visit Chen Xinwen, who had been living incognito for many years.

;

;;

;

;"The Eighth Suspect" (2023)

;

;In the movie "The Eighth Suspect" released on September 9, 2023, Hong Kong actor Lin Jiadong Plays the role of retired policeman Wang Shouyue. There is only one gunfight scene in the film, and there is no suspense element. The audience already knows who the person who has not been arrested is. The highlight is the details of the confrontation between Wang Shouyue and Chen Xinwen.

;

;This film will be shortlisted for the main competition unit of the Shanghai International Film Festival in June 2023. When interviewed, rival actors Dapeng (;plays Chen Xinwen;) and Sun Yang mentioned that they are used to rehearsing before filming, while Jiadong and Lin The other actors kept their distance and "just come up and give it" to protect the immediacy of their reactions. Lin Jiadong is very relaxed.

;

;What they were talking about was an office drama. Wang Shouyue could not bear the noise of construction at the construction site and went to the construction company to report the situation. Chen Xinwen and several others were studying the drawings. Wang Shouyue thought they were studying real estate development, but in fact they were plotting to rob. That was a few days before the shocking case occurred more than 20 years ago.

;

;"I don't know what you will do next, and you don't know what I will do next, so outside of the camera, we keep a sense of distance." Lin Jiadong said. He felt this was the best way to communicate that suited the needs of the character. Cheung Song-man, who plays a police colleague, likes to be flexible on the set, and Lam Ji-tung happily accepted the role. "I can change whatever you suddenly change. Because my role is still in my hands, and your role is still in your hands."

;

;Lin Jiadong has been a film actor for 22 years. In 2002, he played a policeman in a movie for the first time, as Big B in "Infernal Affairs". On the rooftop, after the duel scene between Chen Yongren and Liu Jianming pointed guns at each other and revealed their trump cards, the audience thought the outcome was decided. Unexpectedly, in the elevator, Big B appeared and simply killed the real policeman Chen Yongren, revealing his identity as an undercover gangster. The identity caught Liu Jianming, a fake policeman who was also an undercover and wanted to start a new life, off guard.

;

;This is the last scene of the whole film. Before this, Lin Jiadong had never seen the complete script, and he really thought that Big B was a good policeman - the director intended it. Suddenly learning that his identity was reversed, Lin Jiadong panicked, fearing that he would make a mistake. At that time, he was still ignorant and needed to listen to the arrangements of his seniors.

;

;In an early episode of "A Date with Lu Yu", Andy Lau, who played Liu Jianming and was Lin Jiadong's boss, mentioned that he wanted Lin Jiadong to lose the "air of a TV series".

;

;;

;

;"Slaying the Wolf: Greedy Wolf" (2017)

;

;Lin Jiadong entered the TVB artist training class in 1987. The first time he filmed was during the Spring Festival, which was originally scheduled The actors went on strike, so he had a chance to take over. In the 1990s, he became a relatively successful actor in TV dramas. The high-intensity shooting schedule made him feel brain-blocked and "he wanted to be perfect, but he couldn't do it." He wanted to change his life, switched to the film industry, and signed a contract with Andy Lau's company. "Even if it is an idle role or an inconspicuous small role, when the camera comes to you, you will be the protagonist for the second. Don't waste this opportunity, play this role well." He once said in an interview.

;

;Director Johnnie To's "Underworld" (;2005;) has many acting talents, including Simon Yam, Tony Leung Ka-fai, Lam Suet, Nick Cheung did not cover up Lin Jiadong's shining point. In a year of handover between gangs and winning streaks, the younger generation competes for power. Dongguan Zai, played by Lam Jiadong, is loyal to one of the factions. He is obedient, ruthless, and his ambitions gradually expand. Fans began to recognize him. Soon, the role of the traitor Li Zhao in "Ip Man" (;2008;) won Lam Jiadong the Hong Kong Film Awards (< span style="font-family: Kaiti, Kaiti_GB2312, STKaiti;">;"Hereinafter referred to as the Academy Awards";) Nominated for Best Supporting Actor.

;

;;

;

;"Ip Man" (2008)

;

;Hong Kong is rich in police and gangster movies. Lam Jiadong has played both police and gangsters. Some of the policemen he plays are polite and capable, while others are sophisticated. "I have been a policeman many times, and every time I am looking for differences. Because I believe that a person who has lived for so many years must have different mental states, thoughts, and personalities. . I have this opportunity to put different possibilities." Lin Jiadong said.

;

;;

;

;"Cold War" (2012)

;

;In 2013, he won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role as Albert, a senior police officer in "Cold War" Nominated. In the film, the hawks and the civil servants are at odds with each other, the rivalry between Tony Leung Ka Fai and Aaron Kwok is brilliant, and the new police officer played by Eddie Peng is a lurking villain who wants to help his father (;Tony Leung Ka Fai's role;) clears the obstacles to promotion and has a big turn; in comparison, Albert's image is by no means the fullest and most brilliant, but Lin Jiadong holds his own.

;

;Lin Jiadong has also played a kind-faced but cold-blooded gangster. With the indifferent King of Thieves, he also won the Hong Kong Film Awards, the Hong Kong Film Critics Society, and the Hong Kong Film Directors Association Best Actor.

;

;;

;

;"Wisdom Teeth" (2021)

;

;In 2022, he won two Academy Awards for Best Actor for the two films "Hand-Rolled Cigarettes" and "Wisdom Teeth" Protagonist nomination. Among them, "Hand-Rolled Cigarettes" he starred in for zero pay, playing a person abandoned by society: his character Guan Chao was a Chinese-American British soldier more than 20 years ago. After retirement, his life was frustrated, he owed loan sharks, and made a living as a gangster. A hunted Indian in trouble ends up in danger himself.

;

;Lin Jiadong is 56 years old this year. His screen image in recent years, from Guan Chao to Wang Shouyue, has a gloomy and aging look. But he himself is well maintained and has a slim figure.

;

;One night in early September, at around 9 o'clock, after a busy day's work, Lin Jiadong's interest was still high when he talked about performances, such as "Homicide" (;2023;) His free play in the rooftop scene at the end of the film allowed him to play the numerology master who muttered to himself after the split personality: "I am a flower, I am a flower." For example, The subtle change in Guan Chao's attitude toward Indians in "Hand-Rolled Cigarettes" is due to the change of the other person's name.

;

;He has an excellent memory and can quickly recall the last scene of "Underworld" and how the ambitious Dongguan boy handled the lines breathlessly. From time to time, he added body movements to restore the image of himself locked in a room and thinking hard: he would collapse on the sofa, sit up again for half an hour, and act as if he were reading a script, looking for a breakthrough.

;

;Wang Shouyue is a boring person. After finally retiring, his life still feels like work. This may be a bit like Lin Jiadong. He has appeared on TVB or other TV talk shows many times and said that he is boring and boring.

;

;He is a hard-working actor. Even if he won the Best Actor Award, he said he could only "have fun for 48 hours" and then he would want to work. That year, holding the trophy, he said to himself on the stage, calm down. Then he said, "Over the years, I have felt that acting does not matter age. It does not matter about appearance, the most important thing is your own heart."

;

;The following is Lin Jiadong's account:

; < h4>;Police feelings;

;;I think Wang Shouyue's character is a bit different. In the past, I have watched many police movies depicting police officers. There isn’t much emotion shown, but this time I think it’s a good opportunity because this character is a person with emotions. ;

;

;;The first dinner was at the retirement dinner. I actually felt a little depressed and regretful. After more than 20 years, (The suspect) can’t be seen or caught, what should I do? ;

;

;;Later I confronted the character of Dapeng and gradually got to know him. He had done something wrong. A poor man who decided. I saw the newsreel of him at the fire scene, which was not too glamorous, so I wanted to see with my own eyes what he was like now. He must be not doing well, right? I don’t know if we can capture him and by what method. ;

;

;;In the office scene, the character conflicts have not yet appeared. What I do is follow my body language to put pressure on them: come back - stop - go, talk, come back again, blah blah, like this. I think it can be handled this way, it is enough. If there are too many emotions, it will be fake. You don’t know who they are, and they don’t know who you are. If I want to make the audience feel the pressure through the picture, this reaction of body language is enough. . ;

;

;;Before every performance, I am used to taking a look at the scene here to adapt to my identity and mood. , my relationship with other characters in it. ;

;

;;I must respect the style of the director and cinematographer. Some directors and photographers use the lens to help them do a lot of things. They don’t need me to do much. I will cooperate with you on the shooting scene. But if it’s a fixed shot and you let me go, then the camera lens is here, the space is so big, I can do as much as I can in this space. ;

;

;Emotionality and Sobriety

;

;;The actor is very emotional inside the camera, but outside the camera We should be sober. I remember who I met and what I talked about every day. I will ask friends with different ideas how they feel about new immigrants. ;

;

;;There are different people in every industry, and I want to feel where their vitality lies. Every time I take a vacation, I chat with some friends from outside the industry. Some are in aquatic services, drive taxis, sell diamonds, do public relations for big brands, and some are bosses, working in finance in Central. Most of my friends are very talkative. If I listen more, I will understand that their life circle, thinking, and common attitude are like this. Their lives satisfy me. I slowly accumulate and build my experience, and I know very concretely about future performances. ;

;

;;For example, many large companies lay off employees, always laying off front-line people. Your manager’s one month’s labor If the cost is enough for 10 people, it would be enough to lay off one of you. But many companies have more generals than soldiers. Why is it so strange? This involves the issue of human nature. People must protect themselves. But if the general has 10 fewer soldiers, how can he fight? There are really too many problems in life. ;

;

;;I was originally the villain in "Cold War". I told the director that I was very happy to play the villain, but it would be very damaging to your movie. In reality, for the management of a large company to survive, it depends not only on how strong the ability is, but also on patience. Don't go too far, you must know how to accept it. Albert has a doctorate in law and is extremely well-educated. It is impossible for him to be attracted to Peng Yuyan's role. Two weeks later, the director really changed it and made my character die in the end, which made me happy. ;

;

;;When I was young, I seldom spoke. My elder sister was the only one who talked at home, and my elder sister didn’t understand. We rarely communicate about boys’ ideas. But I read a lot of things every day, and I’m thinking in my head, why is this like this? Wear a black suit to a wedding banquet. My friend, when I go to a funeral parlor, I wear a black suit, so how do I tell whether it’s a red event or a white event? Lots of whys. Later, when we took a training class, the teacher also told us that life is an experience, and you must remember this feeling. Just think more carefully, watch more, think more, find a root for the character's personality, and your future creations will be more reasonable. ;

;

;;My friend and I were very bored. We were hungry after 1 o'clock at night, so we asked where we could eat supper. OK? Tea restaurants are the best, offering both Chinese and Western food and drinks. Takeout, no need. Go in and sit down, eat what you want, and see if you are fat (at this time). If I'm not fat, I like to eat ketchup powder the most. If I'm fat, I can't drink milk tea or coffee. My friend and I ordered a set meal. I’ll give you the food, and I can just drink this, so there’s no waste. ;

;

;;The tea restaurant is a very real place without so many shackles. In the hotel, everyone is very quiet, saying something they don’t know (simulating whispers), and no emotion can be seen. There is a very real life in the tea restaurant, people are very willing to express their emotions, and you can learn a little gossip. This is the most comfortable look. I'm going now too. It is not difficult to be a mountain person and close yourself off; but life is very important and it is important to experience life, otherwise how can we perform? ;

;

;;

;

;"Infernal Affairs" (2002)

;

;Unwilling

;

;;When I came to TVB in the 1980s, I had no idea what acting was, so I took that training class. I gradually got to know and like it, but I was not content with just acting, because I felt that some of the acting was acting and very technical. , but not good enough and not committed. ;

;

;;I was shocked before the performance of "Infernal Affairs" (the last scene). Andy Lau, Liu Weiqiang, you lied to me, why should I shoot Chen Yongren? OK, give me a minute. They must know the script very well. I only know a little bit about the character and I don't know anything else, so I have to trust them. ;

;

;;But I must admit that after editing, I can accept the finished film. What is the most popular thing? Mask, when facing different scenes and different characters, people will wear different masks. This is what I learned from that scene. ;

;

;;(As for the qualitative change in performance) I think it should be from "Underworld" to "Ip Man" . The audience has seen me as a gentle boy before. ;

;

;;

;

;"Underworld" (2005)

;

;;"Underworld" 》The director is Johnnie To, I don’t know what the director is thinking. When I arrived at the scene, I just got the script 30 minutes ago and knew the dialogue, so I gave it a try. Just go with your feelings. The director said OK, and I asked if I could do another one. The director said, I think it’s OK. Really? I feel like I owe a little bit. Director Du said I don't need it, don't you believe me? I believe it. (Laughs);

;

;;We can't watch the playback either, only the director can. There were only one or two group scenes, and other times there was no opponent, just me acting alone. So I don't really have much idea. Watching it in the cinema, I thought, can a performance be like this? It turns out that the creative changes are so big. The screenwriter and director know us actors very well and can change us to a certain extent, giving the audience a very new but very real feeling. I think it is very powerful and has a profound impact on me. Then I should still have a chance. I am not willing to be like this. ;

;

;;It was my first time to go to "Ip Man". The shooting of that movie had not started yet. I went to Shanghai, I hid in my room for the first three days and nights. I didn't leave the room to eat. My assistant brought the food and put it at the door. It was like living in a prison. The film was shot in three days. I thought about how to deal with this character. With this little space, I could express the helplessness of Li Zhao. ;

;

;;Li Zhao is a traitor, and it is not good to be a traitor, but I told the director that I ( Referring to Li Zhao) I am not in Beijing or Nanjing, so I cannot see the issue of power. I am in Foshan, and I really don’t have much money, so I have to survive. In one scene, the opposite character died. I never thought that people would die for a bag of rice. It didn’t matter if they were beaten or injured. There was nothing you could do about it in those days, but death seemed a little too much. ;

;

;;During filming, because the director did not call cut, I gave a long reaction. I asked the director to make it longer, even if it was cut later. At that time, I began to know that I had to capture the soul and heart of the character. Fortunately, director Sammo Hung said it could be done. Thanks. "Ip Man" gave me the opportunity, the camera, and the time to do it. Let me tell the audience again through this lens, Li Zhao, are you sad? ;

;

;Think about it first

;

;;After filming a scene, I will let myself becomes blank. I take a computer with me when I go to other places. I can stay in my room for a whole day without going out, watching and thinking, because I have entered another character and I don’t think about the past anymore. It’s easy to get stuck if you keep thinking about the past. ;

;

;;I don't regard it as a job, it is my interest. Sometimes the director calls and asks: Are you in the company? "Here." "How are you lately? I thought of a case, what do you think?" "It's interesting." "Then I'll bring the screenwriter over to talk to you in two days." "Okay." That's it. ;

;

;;For example, recently, there was an investor who was not looking for me to perform. He said that now Hong Kong Movies are really difficult, and he hopes to make a limited-edition film with content. Let me think about it, it could be this or that. He said, "Can you be my producer? Come and talk to the director." Then the investor asked me to perform. I thought it would be fun, so I collaborated with him. The project is still in the creation stage. Everyone feels that Hong Kong movies may have fewer and fewer themes. I hope that through my own efforts, I can get more space for the audience to watch different themes. ;

;

;;

;

;"Hand-rolled Cigarettes" (2020)

;

;;《 The film "Hand-Rolling Cigarettes" is supported by the Hong Kong government (Author's note: "Hand-Rolling Cigarettes" is the winning entry in the fourth tertiary college category of Hong Kong's "First Feature Film Project" and was filmed with funding from the Hong Kong Film Development Council) and is spent on Hong Kong tax dollars People’s money, I said I don’t want the remuneration, but I have to work on the script well. I talked to the Film Development Bureau: I think this subject has potential, but I think it can be better. Can you give me three more months? The other party said yes, you can just perform. I kept chatting with the director and producer. I felt there was room for improvement. Don’t waste it. Think about it first. A week later, we worked on the script again. ;

;

;;"Hand-rolled Cigarettes" is a whole movie about a few people who have been abandoned by society. Guan Chao He is a British soldier, and his South Asian friend Vinny is a new immigrant who seems not to be accepted by the mainstream. So they have a line of dialogue where Vinny says, this place is different than I imagined. Guan Chao said, you are stupid. Do you think you have gone to heaven? ;

;

;;Most of the plot of "Hand-Rolled Cigarettes" takes place in Guan Chao's home, a cramped hut. The first time I saw the scenery, the light was very bright. Tsim Sha Tsui is a very prosperous place in Hong Kong. Many signboards are very bright and colorful. I said, director, please believe me. Guan Chao relies on the light from outside to illuminate his life. In fact, his life is not bright at all. It needs to have a dark effect. ;

;

;;I also told the director that the entire society in the 1990s was very opportunistic and people were greedy. What would you do if you had no identity? make up? make money. At that time, I was filming a TV series at TVB, and the photographer was also filming all the time, watching the rise and fall of the stock market. So there was a guy in the movie who was trading stocks and lost. ;

;

;;I will tell you with a little bit of life experience, I think this look best matches "Hand-Rolled Cigarettes" this content. The reason why the movie is so full is because I have experienced it. ;

;On September 15, after being rescued from Myanmar and returning to China, a doctor from the Chinese Academy of Sciences posted a self-narrative video for the first time in response to online questions. Doctor from the Chinese Academy of Sciences who was deceived posted his salary slip from Myanmar” became a hot search on the Internet. Nandu reporters learned from the video and the person involved, Mr. Zhang, that there was a misunderstanding in the hot search on the Internet. What he posted was actually his previous salary slip of 4,000 to 5,000 yuan per month in China. He said that at that time, he had to spend a lot of money because his family members were sick. "I was the only one working in the whole family, so I faced great financial pressure."

;

;;;

;Mr. Zhang posted a self-report video in response to online questions.

;

;Mr. Zhang said in the video, “I have been interviewed by many media and investigated by the police during this period, but there are still some doubts on the Internet.” Therefore, he hopes to respond to eliminate Everyone’s doubts.

;

;;;

;Mr. Zhang’s pay stub in China before he was defrauded.

;

;As for why he chose to work abroad, he explained that at that time he was working in a research institute of the Chinese Academy of Sciences in China, and his monthly salary was about four to five thousand yuan. In 2022, his parents and girlfriend were both sick and needed to spend a lot of money. "At that time, I was the only one working in the family and faced great financial pressure."

;

;But at that time, his job search was not going smoothly. He submitted dozens of resumes but received no response. He said frankly, "This really hurt my self-confidence, so I finally thought of seeing if there were any job opportunities abroad."

;

;The foreign job that got him involved in the Myanmar fraud complex was through an intermediary Looking for it. Mr. Zhang said that he trusted the other party because he had been helping domestic people find job opportunities abroad for many years. The agency recommended him a job in Singapore. “The salary is relatively reasonable, 15,000 yuan per month plus commission, and he works six days a week, 10 hours a day. It’s harder than jobs in China, but food and accommodation are included. The treatment is relatively reasonable, so I plan to give it a try."

;

;In a previous interview, Mr. Zhang told Nandu reporters that he originally hoped to seek job opportunities abroad, but was lured to a fraud park in Myanmar. They worked 18 hours a day under strict supervision, were punished corporally if they failed to complete their performance, and were severely beaten if they were found to have "leaked secrets". Later, after various rescue efforts, he returned to China on September 5.

;

;In his view, being defrauded has nothing to do with academic qualifications or experience. "Fraud takes advantage of the weaknesses of human nature, and anyone can become a victim."

;

;On the afternoon of September 15, a staff member of the Lushan Botanical Garden of the Chinese Academy of Sciences told Nandu reporters that Mr. Zhang was once a formal employee of the unit, and "the salary has been adjusted in accordance with the relevant regulations of the province." , which falls under the standards of public welfare institutions. In addition, there are doctoral allowances and other expenses, but the specific salary is not clear.

;Recently, an accusation of "cutting corners on a highway bridge" has attracted attention. On August 30, 2023, a netizen surnamed Liu with the online name "Liu Shao" reported in real name on the social media platform that there were construction quality problems in the Qinghai Tongsai Expressway Taohe Bridge built by China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau No. 5 Company.

;

;Liu claimed to be the actual construction party and began to undertake the substructure project of the Taohe Bridge on April 6, 2022, which lasted more than eight months. He reported that the project leader of China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company "did not use steel bars from the shortlisted manufacturers according to the design, privately used non-standard steel bars from non-shortlisted manufacturers, cut corners during construction, and used unqualified sand and gravel materials during winter construction, resulting in poor concrete quality." qualified". Among them, statements such as "the pile inspection process changed the second-category piles to the first-category piles", "80% of the pile foundation steel bars are unqualified" and "there are hidden safety and quality risks" attracted the attention of the outside world.

;

;On the evening of September 6, the Fifth Company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau issued a public statement stating that it had previously entrusted Qinghai Provincial Traffic Inspection Co., Ltd. as a third-party testing agency to conduct quality inspections on the bridge. The inspection report shows that "the physical quality of the Taohe Bridge meets the design requirements and the quality is qualified." The steel bars and concrete used in the construction are all qualified, and the pile foundation tests are all Class I piles. Liu's reports have been refuted one by one. At present, the competent authority has entrusted a testing agency to "conduct physical quality inspection and raw material sampling inspection", and the re-inspection results will be announced to the public in a timely manner.

;

;Liu didn’t buy it. He showed evidence to "Running News" and said, "The test report I got contains Class II piles." The pouring time was May 26, 2022. The test date is June 29, 2022. Liu admitted that he made the report because the Fifth Company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau not only refused to pay him for his labor services, but instead cleared him from the site, causing heavy losses to him. “Now I have to report the project quality issues even if I don’t need any money.”

;

;According to media reports, Liu was sued by China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company to the People's Court of Ledu District, Haidong City, Qinghai Province for infringing the company's reputation rights because he reported that his labor fees had not been settled. The case will be heard in court on September 18. Liu also presented evidence, saying that he had received a message from the other party "Look at the hardness of our China Railway No. 5 Bureau" after reporting with his real name; the other party also proposed a "compensation plan", but he did not agree if he was not satisfied. The Fifth Company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau responded that Liu’s main purpose was blackmail and “I will report it as soon as I don’t get the blackmail.”

;

;This incident has evolved to this point and has gradually become "out of focus": the dispute between Liu and China Railway has become a new hot spot. A closer look at this incident reveals that there are actually two important aspects that deserve further analysis and questioning.

;

;First, the relationship between the civil dispute between Liu and the Fifth Company of China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau and his reporting behavior.

;

;Whether it is Liu's self-report or the "extortion of money" accusation from China Railway No. 5 Bureau, it is shown that the report was due to Liu's financial demands and that the two parties had a civil dispute. But what is curious is why the case was initiated by China Railway No. 5 Engineering Co., Ltd. against Liu for "infringement of reputation rights" instead of Liu launching a civil lawsuit against China Railway No. 5 Engineering Co., Ltd. due to a labor contract dispute?

;

;The cause of this incident was an economic dispute over "unpaid labor fees". Following this line of thought, Liu first reported the problem when he could not get the labor fee, but was sued for "infringement of reputation rights". Then, instead of filing a civil lawsuit on the grounds of a labor contract dispute and demanding payment of the labor fee, he filed an online lawsuit He reported that the project was cutting corners and materials, saying "I have to report project quality problems even if I don't get labor fees," and rejected China Railway's compensation plan. This shows that Liu escalated the incident at all costs, giving the outside world the impression that "the fish is dead and the net is broken."

;

;Looking at the evolution of the incident, there are still some questions hidden in the game between the two parties during this period: Has Liu's labor fee been settled? If it was indeed not settled, Liu initially went to China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau and the relevant departments in Qinghai to report this problem. I am afraid it was just a normal rights protection. Why was he sued by the Fifth Company of China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau for "infringement of the company's reputation rights"?

;

;In the chat records provided by Liu, the words of a person from the China Railway No. 5 Bureau after the real-name report, "The more you cause trouble, the less afraid I am. Look at the hardness of our China Railway No. 5 Bureau" to the outside world. It leaves more room for interpretation. This sentence can make people reasonably speculate that Liu chose to "turn the table" by exposing the quality problems of the project precisely because his demands for labor fees were repeatedly ignored by the other party. So, will the labor fees be settled on time, or will the compensation plan of China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company satisfy Liu after the report, and the matter will be settled smoothly?

;

;If Liu came out to expose the project quality problems just because the labor fees were not paid, and the project quality problems were true, then the whole incident would have the flavor of "unevenly sharing the spoils, and turning the table over in anger". The problem behind it is undoubtedly more worrying; or, if the truth is as claimed by China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company, Liu intends to "extort money", then whether the test results and the evidence he presented are forged, and how much his labor fees are? A clear answer should also be given as to why it was not settled and why it was not settled.

;

; Sat, 16 Sep 2023 10:25:03 +0800 吼书、盲书、射书、乱书，哪种是真正的书法？http://www.infzm.com/contents/256848

;

;Wang Dongling has a notebook with "dirty material". The notebook is filled with comments from netizens who "spite" him, such as "Wang Dongling is a braggart" and "Wang Dongling has gone crazy..." Wang Dongling opened the notebook, which contained both serious critical articles and vulgar abuse. "When a compilation of information about me is printed in the future, all of this can be printed." Wang Dongling said with a smile.

;

;;

;

;In November 2016, Wang Dongling's calligraphy art solo exhibition opened at the Taimiao Art Museum in Beijing, and he was swiping at the scene. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Wang Dongling is a calligrapher, but he is also happy to be called a calligrapher. modern artist. Rather than being praised by his peers, the "chaotic books" he created gained more from the incomprehension of ordinary audiences. Wang Dongling's "chaotic calligraphy" is not the first to be criticized for modern calligraphy, and it will certainly not be the last. In recent years, netizens have criticized Zeng Xiang's "Roaring Book", Zhang Qiang's "Blind Book" and Shao Yan's "Shooting Book"... As the name suggests, when creating "Roaring Book", Zeng Xiang was drunk. He seemed to be mad, roaring and yelling; when Zhang Qiang wrote, he didn't look at the brush and the writing object, and applied it by hand; Shao Yan filled the ink with a needle and sprayed the words on the rice paper, which can be said to follow the shape of the object... Popular opinion Not understanding these various new "calligraphy", some people simply call them "ugly calligraphy". In the newly released movie "The Story of Yong'an Town", the director who is good at ridicule pokes fun at the film industry, but also satirizes the "Master of Shouting Books".

;

;Compared with them, Wang Dongling still looks like traditional calligraphy at least in the "movements" of his creation - but people still can't see clearly what he wrote in his "random calligraphy". When I open a piece of Wang Dongling's "chaos calligraphy" work, I can see intersecting lines, like dead branches on the ground, and like swords fighting in chaos, but not a single clear and independent Chinese character can be seen.

;

;;

;

;Wang Dongling's "Li Bai Poetic" calligraphy installation was exhibited at the China Academy of Art Museum's "Calligraphy·Not Calligraphy - 2019 International Modern Calligraphy Art Festival". ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;At a social inscription scene, Wang Dongling asked the organizer with a sly smile, "Do you want me to Should you write more messily or be more disciplined?" The words to be inscribed were "Art for a better life". The organizer nodded Weiwei and said, "Be more disciplined, be more disciplined." Wang Dongling picked up the brush and thought for a moment. Several big words had already fallen on it. on paper. Looking carefully, the strokes of these characters are indeed much more "regular", with adhesion but little overlap. "My characters are not very intertwined, but there is still some expressiveness in them." Wang Dongling told Southern Weekend the reporter said.

;

;Like Wang Dongling, Zeng Xiang, Shao Yan and Zhang Qiang can also write very "proper" characters. When the public laughs at them, few people ask why they give up "proper" writing. Calligraphy, doing these things that look like performance art?

;

;;

;

;Not all of Wang Dongling's works are in the form of "chaotic calligraphy". The picture shows his works on display at the Zhejiang Art Museum in 2021. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;"Everyone has the desire to criticize and explain. I am now a target to let people have this desire. It looks good to me," Wang Dongling said. Nearly eighty years old, he seems to be in a good mood. He said that when he was young, he could not hear scolding, which would make him feel uncomfortable, but now he has become "early", and he would sometimes laugh out loud when looking through the notebook with "dirty information".

;

;Breaking the "Word Barrier"

;

;Wang Dongling has a thin figure, with dry white hair and messy hair. Sometimes she speaks in a breathless voice, and you have to get closer to hear it clearly. It was startling. If his voice is compared to a calligraphy work, then his layout is what Deng Shiru said: "It can be sparse but airtight."

;

;;

;

;Wang Dongling once presented Chinese cultural classics in the form of "chaotic scripts" and "wall scripts". The picture shows the large-scale mirror wall book "I Ching" he exhibited in 2016. It is written on a stainless steel plate with white paint and is 32 meters long and 3.5 meters high. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;The first impression given by "Chaoshu" is its white cloth and unique composition. "Zhangfa" and "Bubai" are calligraphy terms, which refer to the arrangement, layout and mutual response between words and lines during the entire writing process. In traditional calligraphy works, the line spacing is roughly clear, and the strokes cannot cross between words. Even the continuous grass of the late Ming Dynasty will still generally abide by such rules. "Look at Xu Wei's "Ying Zhi Ying Sword", there are a few places where the strokes touch and cross, but it is not obvious." Wang Dongling zoomed in on Xu Wei's work on her mobile phone and kept zooming in until the complete picture could no longer be seen. Glyphs and dancing lines fill the entire phone screen.

;

;When he was a child, Wang Dongling observed an old tree in front of his teacher’s house, and the zigzag lines were imprinted in his memory. Later, he also looked at the trees in the American wilderness and found that the lines created by the vitality of the trees were different, but intersected harmoniously.

;

;Every winter, he goes to see the dead lotuses on the West Lake. He has more than 20,000 photos of dead lotuses on his computer. Look at the dead lotus stems, all scattered and scattered, seemingly chaotic, but there is an underlying order in the chaos. When the ideographic nature of Chinese characters is completely covered up - like the enlarged Xu Wei that makes it difficult to see what character it is, then only the lines of the Chinese characters are left in front of the viewer's eyes.

;

;In the history of calligraphy, the "overlapping" of characters can be traced back to Yan Zhenqing's "Seat Struggle", but that may be unconscious. When it came to Xu Wei, "I think his calligraphy was intended to break the line spacing," Wang Dongling said. Later, Zheng Banqiao's calligraphy was called "paving the streets with random stones." "In fact, they all wanted to break the calligraphy and line spacing." "

;

;"Chaoshu" is to push this "break" to the extreme. If you look at Wang Dongling's random writing process, every word he writes is actually in accordance with cursive writing (cursive, a calligraphy term, refers to the cursive writing rules of Chinese characters. The cursive writing of each character is roughly fixed and conventional). "It's nothing more than an overlap."

;

;When words overlap and strokes intertwine, the viewer cannot clearly see what is written. Therefore, the "word barrier" for Chinese people to read calligraphy is broken, and they can concentrate on feeling the lines. flow.

;

;;

;

;In 2021, the 60-year exhibition of Wang Dongling's calligraphy art was held at Zhejiang Art Museum. The picture shows an audience staying in front of Wang Dongling's works. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;For Chinese people, when they look at a piece of calligraphy, they first of course want to understand what it says. , in Wang Dongling's opinion, is a "writing barrier", which keeps many ordinary people away from the deeper beauty of calligraphy. Just like someone listens to his mother tongue and understands the meaning, but unconsciously ignores the beauty of the pronunciation. Only people who do not understand the language at all will notice the high and low pitch values ​​and the gentleness of the timbre when listening. .

;

;"Calligraphy has developed over thousands of years. Traditional calligraphy has been very perfect and mature. It is difficult for you to break through at all." Wang Dongling said that calligraphy has two attributes, one is cultural attribute, and the other is cultural attribute. It is Chinese characters written by Chinese people, so we naturally want to understand it, "There is nothing wrong with this", but another attribute of calligraphy is its artistic attribute. If you admit that it is an art, then it must Have personality and express the creator.”

;

;“Chaotic script is the extension of ancient cursive script.” This is Wang Dongling’s own understanding of chaotic script. He puts his creation into the track of the ancients, “Of course my heart is not as wild as Xu Wei’s. , but you must have passion to write cursive."

;

; Can people who understand music learn calligraphy faster?

;

;Walking into Wang Dongling’s studio, the floor is covered with all kinds of manuscript papers, rice paper, and albums. It can be said to be a “street full of paper.” This studio has received many foreigners who admired Chinese calligraphy. "Professor Wang Dongling gave me my first calligraphy lesson." In 2015, Apple CEO Tim Cook said on Weibo. At that time, Cook visited Wang Dongling's studio, and Wang Dongling taught him to use Apple pencil to write the word "goodbye" with calligraphy strokes on the iPad. Prior to this, he was invited to Apple headquarters in California to provide professional calligraphy advice on the iPad’s writing capabilities.

;

;For Apple, this Weibo undoubtedly has a strong marketing temperament, but Wang Dongling does not reject invitations from other cultures.

;

;In March 1989, Wang Dongling went to give lectures at the University of Minnesota in the United States. What he brought with him was a large pen and the "Longzang Temple Stele" which he copied repeatedly. Wang Dongling still remembers the winter in Minnesota, when there was heavy snow outside the window, and his car was stuck deep in the snow, like an ink mark in the snow.

;

;Wang Dongling’s English is very poor. In his own words, when he first arrived in the United States, he didn’t know all 26 letters. So far, I may only recognize 200 words. But he is very willing to exchange calligraphy with foreigners. In 1981, Wang Dongling received a master's degree in calligraphy from Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts (now China Academy of Art) and stayed at the school to teach. At that time, Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts was the only school in the country that majored in calligraphy, so the Ministry of Culture sent all international students studying calligraphy to Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts. From then on, Wang Dongling took on the task of teaching calligraphy to international students.

;

;Even now, many people still feel that it is impossible to teach Westerners to learn calligraphy. They do not understand ancient Chinese, and learning Chinese characters does not happen overnight. But Wang Dongling's teaching practice told him that this does not seem to be the case. "They often make mistakes in stroke order and structure, and even write wrong words. But this is not a problem." In Wang Dongling's view, foreigners have overcome the "writing barrier" from the beginning.

;

;British art historian Gombrich once concluded that the role of calligraphy in Chinese culture corresponds well with music in European culture. Wang Dongling's experience tells him that students who have previous musical accomplishments will learn faster. "The form of cursive calligraphy art is a division of space by overflowing tension and irregular lines. This kind of space displayed after black and white treatment is full of changes in virtual reality and rhythm, and it is a musical space." Wang Dongling said .

;

;The Internet celebrity "Teacher Andy" of Bilibili, who is now over seventy years old, has been working tirelessly to popularize Western classical music to the public on the Chinese Internet in recent years. His full name is Andreas Stier. German, he is a piano professor at the Hamburg State University of Music. He was once a student of Wang Dongling. Wang Dongling still remembers that in the 1980s, he took Andy Shi and several other international students to the home of Mr. Lu Yanshao. Mr. Lu Yanshao read the works of several foreign students in turn and saw the "Silence" in the "Taishan Diamond Sutra" written by Andy Shi. "Chinese people have not been able to write at this level for a long time."

;

;In 1990, Wang Dongling was in the United States, watching various contemporary art and contemporary dances. Once, he watched an artistic performance by American middle school students. There were solo dances and group dances of three people. The children were twisting their bodies unscrupulously. "Their body language made me feel that no matter how innovative Chinese calligraphy is, it should be allowed," he said. "Wang Dongling said that graffiti, like dancing, is one of human instincts. "The writing of Chinese characters has a strong graffiti nature. Calligraphy is a spiritual artistic product that combines human instincts with Chinese characters." And in Kuangcao. In "Kang Cao", human instincts are released as much as possible. "Kang Cao is greatly weakened from the constraints of ranks, providing a free world for the author to express space. In Kuang Cao, the writing, rhythm and rhythm of calligraphy are brought into full play." ”

;

;Traditional calligraphy, Jianghu style, modern calligraphy

;

;Although Wang Dongling looks thin, in the face of the physically demanding calligraphy, he can write the large-scale "Thousand-Character Essay" 》. It took four hours to write a random piece of "The Thousand Character Essay". In Wang Dongling's own words, it was indeed improvised writing, but it was not a "disordered accident, but a kind of muscle memory after years of training." And when writing, you should always pay attention to the connection between words and the overall layout.

;

;Qi Gong once said, "Layout is very difficult." Layout has also become one of the criteria that distinguishes professional calligraphers from calligraphy enthusiasts generally known as "Jianghu style".

;

;In Wang Dongling's opinion, the current people who study calligraphy can be roughly divided into three types of people. One type is those who follow the traditional path, conscientiously write posts and monuments, and write "good-looking" characters according to traditional standards. This type of people is the cornerstone of calligraphy. The second category is the "jianghu style". "With the participation of all people now, there must be some people who are not good at basic skills but are eager for quick success and quick success. They attract people's attention but have no level. These people can be called 'jianghu style'."< /p>;

;There are also some people who want calligraphy to become a breakthrough modern art. Not only are there people like Wang Dongling who are making breakthroughs within calligraphy, but there are also people who are combining calligraphy with contemporary art such as installation, performance, and video. Some of the "ugly books" considered by the public come from the Jianghu style, and a large number of them come from this group. Wang Dongling also makes no secret that he belongs to the third category. Although his daily training is the same as that of traditional calligraphers, he also has to write calligraphy every day. "In the final analysis, modern calligraphy is to express people's emotions. I am a firm supporter of modern calligraphy and Promoter".

;

;Few people know that the establishment of the first calligraphy major in China actually came from the influence of modern calligraphy. After World War II, Japan regarded calligraphy as an art, engaged in modern calligraphy and avant-garde calligraphy, and attached great importance to the popularization of calligraphy education. In the early 1960s, Pan Tianshou went to Japan to study calligraphy and was deeply moved. He returned to Hangzhou and founded China's first calligraphy and seal cutting major at the Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts with Sha Menghai, Lu Weizhao and others.

;

;In 1979, Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts was commissioned by the Ministry of Culture to recruit the first master's degree students in calligraphy in the country. Wang Dongling became a student of Sha Menghai, Lu Weizhao and other gentlemen, and was one of the first five masters of calligraphy in New China. In the autumn of 1980, Wang Dongling accompanied Mr. Sha Menghai to Beijing to see the original stone drum exhibition at the Palace Museum. I have read Han Yu's "Song of the Stone Drum", seen the original rubbings of "The Inscriptions on the Stone Drum", and read Wu Changshuo's "The Inscription on the Stone Drum", but when I saw the original copy of the Stone Drum, "Even if I don't look at the specific words, the kind of text that the Stone Drum carries The atmosphere of ancient times makes people deeply moved. This experience is the same as looking at the statue in front of Huo Qubing's tomb, which is very wonderful." In Wang Dongling's own memories, this trip to Beijing brought a great shock to his artistic concept. "I feel that the highest state of calligraphy is far from the stability and exquisiteness of pointillism. What is more important is that lines can carry abundant vitality and inexhaustible vitality."

;

;In the 1990s, Wang Dongling After returning to the United States, he began to devote himself to promoting and practicing modern calligraphy. Since then, he has been subjected to pressure and ridicule from all walks of life. At first, there were doubts from the professional calligraphy community. In recent years, the situation has reversed. The professional calligraphy community has turned to a positive evaluation of him, but the public in the Internet age has made an even harsher voice.

;

;Wang Dongling has some intuitive self-explanations to explain the creation process of chaos books to the public, such as Huai Su watching the peaks of summer with many strange clouds, Zhang Xu watching Gongsun Auntie dancing with a sword, Huang Tingjian watching the boatmen rowing, all enlightened He developed new calligraphy skills, and connected his random calligraphy with the residual lotus. When asked if this was an afterthought, he smiled and said, "the two grew out of each other."

;

;Like Zeng Xiang, the "master of shouting", he likes to write big characters. When he writes, there are many onlookers - but Wang Dongling basically doesn't shout. When writing calligraphy, people are watching and cheering. This is also a tradition. When Zhang Xu writes cursive script, people often watch him. Jin Shengtan listed thirty-three joyful things in life, one of which is "How wonderful it is to watch people write big books in a nest!" He also hopes that people can enjoy calligraphy with the mood of "It is wonderful".

;

;Wang Dongling supports the innovation of calligraphy as a modern art, but he seems quite hesitant about one question. A reporter from Southern Weekend asked him: "Will the innovations of some young people with weak basic skills be successful?" Will it be superficial? But if young people follow the tradition and practice to the state of "old people and books" as the ancients said, and then make innovations and breakthroughs, have they missed the best time in their lives? Is there any hidden meaning in this? Contradiction?" For a person who is still enthusiastic about creation when he is nearly eighty years old, this may not be a problem. Wang Dongling paused for a long time and replied: "Creation must have good basic skills. People with good basic skills should promote them. Create more."

;;2023-09-15 23:00:00;
;

;;

;

;; (Visual China/Picture) ;

;

;The "Book of Mountains and Seas·Beishan Jing" describes: "On Panhou's Mountain... there is a beast, which looks like an ox and has hair on all four joints. It is called an ox." In ancient times, In Tibetan mythology, wild yaks are called "stars" in the sky, and white yaks are especially revered.

;

;Putting aside the veil of mystery, where did the white yak come from in reality?

;

;Both the black yak and the white yak are domesticated by humans from wild yaks. The wild yak is a first-level protected animal in China. Archaeologists have discovered bison and other ungulate fossils in the middle and late Pleistocene strata of the Quaternary about 3 million years ago. Wild yaks were once widely distributed in China. They can be seen everywhere in the Himalayas, Kunlun Mountains and Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. Nowadays, with human development, the distribution area of ​​wild yaks has rapidly shrunk and fragmented. They can only be found in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, mainly living in the Qiangtang National Nature Reserve in Tibet.

;

;Domestic yaks were domesticated from wild yaks. From the past to the present, people have used molecular genetics knowledge, sequencing technology and other biological information methods to extract information from many species by combining morphological similarities with archaeological discoveries. This aspect reveals evidence of wild yak domestication. Professor Liu Jianquan from the School of Ecology of Lanzhou University constructed a complete yak genome structure variation map by studying the genome structure of 23 individuals of domestic yaks and wild yaks. He found that domestic yaks living in the alpine pastoral areas of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau at an altitude of 2,000-5,000 meters are descended from humans. It was domesticated 7,300 years ago from the wild yak that currently lives in the uninhabited area of ​​the northern plateau. At the same time, there are highly differentiated structural variations between domestic yaks and wild yaks, that is, structural variations that are subject to artificial selection during domestication. Domestication traits such as genes and nervous system development and behavior, as well as reproductive ability and immunity, are affected by selected structural variations. It is related to functions related to economic traits, providing a new perspective for understanding the genetic mechanism of yak domestication.

;

;The latest survey results of the National Livestock and Poultry Resources Committee in 2019 show that domestic yaks include 17 local breeds and 2 cultivated breeds, distributed in Gansu, Qinghai, Xinjiang, Yunnan, Tibet and Sichuan, and are affected by various Affected by regional geographical conditions, these yak breeds have also formed distinctive local characteristics in the long-term evolution. The most scientifically troubling mystery about these different domestic yaks is the mystery of coat color, especially when and where the white yak was produced. Is the spotted yak the result of a cross between a white yak and a black yak, or a cross with other cattle?

;

;Subsequently, Liu Jianquan’s team cooperated with researcher Yan Ping of the Lanzhou Institute of Animal Husbandry and Pharmacy of the Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences and other research groups. Through nearly 30 years of field sampling, they completed the sampling of all varieties of domestic yaks and more than 20 wild yaks. The yak was sampled and complete DNA was successfully extracted for genome analysis, thereby constructing a genome map of the Bovine species. Research has found that after domestication, domestic yaks were crossed with another type of cattle. Nearly 90% of domestic yaks have genomic structural variations from cattle, accounting for about 1%-5% of all genomic structural variations. Cattle were domesticated from bison in the Near East and the Indus River Basin, and were brought to the Tibetan Plateau by humans no more than 4,000 years ago. The relevant research results "Evolutionary origin of genomic structural variations in domestic yaks" were recently published in the international academic journal "Nature Communications".

;

;It is the genetic introgression from cattle that leads to the key genetic basis for phenotypic variation in different breeds of domestic yak. In layman's terms, within about two thousand years, the domestic yak and the flowered yak produced the flowered yak due to active or passive interspecific hybridization during the grazing process, and the flowered yak then produced the white yak through genetic mutation. This solved the mystery of the "white yak" that has troubled the scientific community. In addition to unraveling scientific mysteries, this study provides a new perspective on the improvement of yak breeds.

;

;Due to the closed breeding environment of yaks and the lack of communication between livestock species, as well as the impact of global climate change and the destruction of natural pastures by overgrazing, the living environment of yaks has deteriorated, and various yak breeds have developed different characteristics. degree of degradation. Therefore, hybrid improvement and breed selection of domestic yaks have become an important task. Although domestic yaks and wild yaks have varying degrees of differences in appearance, breeding methods, production performance and disease resistance, they are generally similar. The biggest difference is that wild yaks have significantly better disease resistance than domestic yaks. Respiratory diseases, parasitic diseases, pasteurellosis and other infectious diseases are common diseases in domestic yaks. Wild yaks are strong and resistant to stress. The weight and other indicators of the first generation of hybrid yaks bred using wild yaks are in line with the local conditions. Compared with domestic yaks of the same age, they were significantly enhanced. Existing research has found that the physique and meat production of domestic yaks in areas with wild yaks are significantly better than those in areas without wild yaks.

;

;Yaks are an indispensable breed of cattle on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. In the future development of the yak industry, we should devote ourselves to the improvement and cultivation of domestic yaks, and use scientific research as technical support to deeply explore the genetic resource advantages of wild yaks. , vigorously improve the production performance of domestic yaks to bring greater economic benefits. As Professor Liu Jianquan said: "In the era of gene editing and transgenics, interspecific hybridization should still be an important means of cultivating new varieties or even new species that adapt to climate change and human needs, but ideas and technologies must be innovative."

;

;The Libyan Red Crescent said that as of the 14th, the number of victims of the disaster in the severely affected city of Derna had reached 11,300, and another 10,100 people were missing. The mayor of Derna estimated that based on the damage, the final number of victims may be much higher than the announced number, "reaching 18,000 to 20,000 people."

;

;;

;

;This is the scene after the floods in the eastern Libyan city of Derna on September 11. Xinhua News Agency (Photo provided by the government appointed by the Libyan National Congress)

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 22:25:05 +0800 中纪委一个月内通报20名 “内鬼” | 时政周报http://www.infzm.com/contents/256827

;;

;

;“灯下黑”问题成为各级纪检监察机关关注的重点。;（界面新闻/图）;

;

;2023年9月15日，中纪委网站再次通报一名“内鬼”被查信息，这是一个月内，中纪委第六批通报的涉嫌严重违纪违法纪检监察干部名单。

;

;最新通报的“内鬼”为中国工商银行原党委委员、纪委书记刘立宪，系主动投案。公开资料显示，刘立宪出生于1954年，曾任最高人民检察院贪污贿赂检察厅副厅长、反贪污贿赂总局副局长、检察技术局局长、检察理论研究所所长等职。

;

;2005年，刘立宪正式加入中国工商银行，当年10月起任中国工商银行纪委书记。在此之后，2013年6月刘立宪还曾被任命为中央第十一巡视组副组长，先后在国家体育总局、中国国电集团公司、中国第一重型机械集团公司、哈尔滨电气集团公司等单位进行过巡视。

;

;本周内，除了刘立宪，中纪委网站还曾于9月11日集中通报过4名“内鬼”信息。

;

;安徽省蚌埠市委常委、市纪委书记项跃文即为其中之一。履历显示，生于1973年的项跃文长期在安徽工作，历任共青团舒城县委书记、共青团六安市委书记、霍山县县长等职。

;

;此次通报发布之前，7月19日，项跃文的名字还出现在安徽纪检监察微信公众号的文章中，文中提到，他出席了安徽省委第二巡视组巡视蚌埠市禹会区、淮上区的工作动员会，并就配合做好巡视工作提出具体要求。

;

;陕西省委巡视工作领导小组办公室原副主任、一级巡视员周明，四川省纪委监委驻成都工业学院纪检监察组组长李仁，以及南京市江宁区委原常委、区纪委原书记杨彬也是和项跃文一同被公布的“内鬼”。

;

;周明长期在陕西省纪委工作，2012年曾以省纪委一室主任身份出席高校反腐工作会议。

;

;出生在江苏镇江的杨彬曾长期在纪检监察系统工作。履历显示，工作以来，杨彬历任南京市沿江工业开发区纪工委副处级纪检监察员，南京市纪委纪检监察二室副处级纪检监察员、三室主任、南京市江宁区纪委书记、区监委主任、南京市委巡察组组长等职。2022年1月，杨彬调任南京市人民检察院党组副书记、副检察长。

;

;拥有法学博士学位的李仁则是从学校走出来的干部，在纪检系统任职的时间不长。1986年从阿坝师专数学系毕业后，李仁留校工作，任共青团阿坝师专委员会副书记，后历任共青团阿坝师专委员会书记，四川省委党校组织处主任干事、助理调研员。2005年后，李仁先后担任遂宁市审计局局长、射洪县委书记、遂宁市副市长等职，直至2019年12月转任四川省纪委监委驻成都工业学院纪检监察组组长。

;

;向前回顾，近一个月内，8月23日、8月25日、8月29日、8月31日，中纪委网站还曾四次集中通报了15名被查“内鬼”的消息。

;

;8月23日的通报人数最多，达6人，分别是山西省纪委监委驻省民政厅纪检监察组组长、省民政厅党组成员贾慕权，广东省委第二巡视组组长苏全贵，海南省委巡视组原副组长吴杰，江苏省常州市委原常委、市纪委原书记沈斌，许昌市纪委原书记、市监委原主任罗军，河北省地质矿产勘查开发局原一级巡视员贺喜。

;

;河南省纪委驻省公安厅纪检组原组长王伟平8月25日被单独通报。除上述人员，海南省委巡视组原组长韩太光，山东省委第十三巡视组原组长岳德川，贵州省文化和旅游厅原党组成员、省纪委监委派驻省文化和旅游厅纪检监察组原组长蒋志伦，内蒙古自治区党委巡视三组组长王亮山，湖北省纪委原副厅级纪检监察员艾绍彬，吉林省水务投资集团有限公司纪委书记、监察专员刘祥玉，哈尔滨市红十字会党组书记、常务副会长刘智，贵州省公安厅原党委委员、省纪委监委派驻省公安厅纪检监察组原组长（正厅级）陈罡也在“内鬼”行列中。

;

;2023年以来，“灯下黑”问题成为各级纪检监察机关关注的重点。9月9日，中央纪委国家监委发文指出，检视整治要更加注重直面问题、一严到底，在查摆问题、自查自纠、清理门户上动真碰硬，坚决清除害群之马、防止“灯下黑”。

;

;7月24日，中纪委网站曾发布过《2023年上半年对纪检监察干部监督检查审查调查情况》，材料显示，2023年前6个月，全国纪检监察系统共接收涉纪检监察干部问题线索、反映2.02万余件次，处置涉及纪检监察干部问题线索1.87万余件，谈话函询纪检监察干部6647人次，立案2482人，处分1647人，移送司法机关73人。其中，位居厅局级的干部有54人，因严重违纪违法被立案审查的有123人。南方周末记者注意到，以上数据同2022年同期相比，几乎都翻了一番。

;

;;人事动向 ;

;

;;【 司法部、科技部、公安部领导调整】;

;

;2023年9月13日，国务院发布国家工作人员任免信息，任命陈家昌为科学技术部副部长，胡卫列为司法部副部长。

;

;陈家昌此前任科技部高新技术司司长，胡卫列此前则担任最高检检察委员会委员、第八检察厅厅长。

;

;9月13日，国务院发布任免国家工作人员信息，免去刘钊的公安部副部长职务。刘钊生于1963年12月，陕西扶风人，曾任公安部交通管理局局长，公安部党委委员、政治部主任，2020年7月被任命为公安部副部长。

;

;;【国台办新任发言人陈斌华亮相媒体】;

;

;9月13日，国务院台湾事务办公室举行新闻发布会，新任发言人陈斌华正式面向媒体亮相。会议伊始，他用普通话和闽南话向在场记者问好。

;

;公开简历显示，陈斌华，1971年生，福建诏安人。出任国台办新闻发言人前，曾有二十多年媒体工作经历。1993年至2016年，陈斌华在新华社总社工作，系大陆首批赴台驻点记者。2016年4月调任国务院台办，历任海研中心副主任、研究局副局长、经济局副局长、一级巡视员。现任国台办新闻局副局长、一级巡视员。

;

;;【央视原主持人王志任中央民族大学副校长】;

;

;近日，中央民族大学官网“学校领导”一栏更新信息显示，曾任央视主持人的王志现已出任中央民族大学党委常委、副校长。公开资料显示，王志生于1965年，大学毕业后分配到湖南电视台，后进入中央电视台，历任《东方之子》栏目记者、主持人，《新闻调查》记者、主持人，《面对面》制片人、主持人、记者。2008年10月，王志挂职出任云南丽江市副市长兼云南省政府新闻办副主任，后调往中国红十字基金会，历任基金会党支部书记等职。2012年7月，王志担任中国传媒大学校长助理。

;

;;;反腐纪事; ;

;

;;【受贿3.25亿余元，中国人寿原董事长王滨一审被判死缓】;

;

;2023年9月12日，济南市中级人民法院就中国人寿保险（集团）公司原党委书记、董事长王滨受贿、隐瞒境外存款一案进行公开宣判，王滨被判处死刑，缓期二年执行，剥夺政治权利终身，并处没收个人全部财产，在其死刑缓期执行二年期满依法减为无期徒刑后，终身监禁，不得减刑、假释。

;

;法庭经审理查明，1997年至2021年间，王滨利用担任中国农业发展银行江西省分行党组副书记、副行长，交通银行北京市分行行长，交通银行副行长，交银国际信托有限公司董事长，中国太平保险董事长，中国人寿董事长兼广发银行董事长等职务便利，直接或间接非法收受财物共计折合人民币3.25亿余元。

;

;;【央企5名管理人员接受审查调查】;

;

;9月14日上午，中央纪委国家监委网站发布通报称，5名央企管理人员正接受审查调查。5人分别为中国能建党委副书记、总经理孙洪水，中国船舶集团华中光电技术研究所原党委书记、副所长赵坤，中储粮集团财务有限公司监事会主席肖明德，中国石化天然气分公司原副总经理吴灿奇，国家能源集团吉林电力有限公司原二级业务总监李占平。

;

;;【被妻子举报出轨，山西一司法所所长被停职】;

;

;9月13日，山西运城市闻喜县司法局发布通报，称接到相关举报，该县辖内阳隅镇司法所所长张某已被停职。据九派新闻报道，举报人系张某妻子。9月11日，张某妻子在网上发视频实名举报称，其丈夫婚内出轨，并多次家暴。该事件在网络上引发广泛关注。

;

;;部委信息 ;

;

;;【住建部：今年保障性租赁住房筹集建设任务已完成超过七成】;

;

;2023年9月12日，住房和城乡建设部表示，今年全国筹集建设保障性租赁住房204万套（间）的任务目前已完成72%。福州、宁波、上海等市筹集建设进度则接近或已超过80％。

;

;数据显示，各地近两年来共已筹集建设保障性租赁住房508万套（间），完成投资超过5200亿元，可用于解决近1500万新市民、青年人的住房困难问题。住房和城乡建设部还提到，未来将继续多措并举，扩大保障性租赁住房供给。

;

;;

;

;江西赣州一装配式钢结构保障房建设工地。;（人民视觉/图）;

;

;;【两部门联合通知要求加强对大型演出的规范管理】;

;

;9月13日，文旅部、公安部联合发布通知，称将进一步加强对5000人以上大型营业性演出活动的规范管理。通知指出，大型演出活动实行实名购票和实名入场制度，每场演出单张身份证件只能购买一张门票，购票人需与入场人身份信息保持一致；举办单位应当建立退票机制，设定合理的梯次退票收费标准。

;

;;【农业农村部：组织东海区三省一市严厉打击非法捕捞行为】;

;

;为贯彻中央一号文件严格执行休禁渔期制度要求，落实国家海洋伏季休渔制度，9月10至11日，农业农村部调配调集浙江、福建、江苏、上海三省一市渔政执法力量，出动中国渔政6艘执法船艇和132名执法人员，突击开展统一收网联合执法行动。据悉，执法行动共抓获涉嫌非法捕捞船舶20艘（含渔运船3艘）、涉案人员216人，查获渔获物10000余箱（约200余吨）。

;

;;法治播报 ;

;

;;【最高检、公安部启动第三批5起特大跨境电信网络诈骗犯罪案件联合挂牌督办】;

;

;近日，最高检、公安部公布，联合挂牌督办第三批5起特大跨境电信网络诈骗犯罪案件。这5起案件分别是，福建莆田“9·6”电信网络诈骗案、重庆沙坪坝“5·11”电信网络诈骗案、江苏江阴“6·16”电信网络诈骗案、浙江温州“8·26”电信网络诈骗案、四川乐山“1·12”电信网络诈骗案。

;

;;【最高检：侵害未成年人强制报告报案量明显上升】;

;

;最高检9月13日消息，2020年5月，侵害未成年人案件强制报告制度正式推出，在及时发现犯罪、制止犯罪、解救未成年人、保护未成年人合法权益方面发挥了重要作用。数据显示，近一年里，侵害未成年人强制报告报案量明显上升，月均报告数量由2022年同期的140件上升为2023年的280件，增幅明显。

;

;最高检介绍，下一步，检察机关将通过“逐案倒查”，强化对未履行强制报告义务的责任追究，进一步压实相关单位与人员的报告责任。

;

;;【中越公安部长签署中越打击跨境赌博合作谅解备忘录】;

;

;中越公安部第八次合作打击犯罪部长级会议9月13日在京举行，会议由中共中央书记处书记、公安部部长王小洪与越共中央政治局委员、越南公安部部长苏林共同主持。

;

;会上，王小洪与苏林共同签署了中越打击跨境赌博合作谅解备忘录。王小洪提到，2021年中越第七次合作打击犯罪部长级会议以来，中越公安部在追逃追赃、打击人口拐卖等多个领域合作圆满，中方愿与越方共同深化落实政治安全、网络安全等方面的合作。苏林则表示，越方愿加强两国执法高层交往，深化各领域执法合作，为各自国家发展营造安全稳定的社会环境。

;

;;;科教动态; ;

;

;;【中国各类科技企业孵化器机构已超过1.5万家】;

;

;2023年9月10日，高质量孵化器发展论坛在上海宝山召开。会上，科技部副秘书长贺德方介绍，截至2022年底，中国建有各类科技企业孵化器机构超过1.5万家，形成了苗圃、孵化器、加速器、科技园区链条式的科技创业服务体系。

;

;贺德方提到，2022年全国各类孵化机构服务初创企业和团队近68万家，带动就业人口500多万人。据悉，近年来从孵化器走出的科技企业，已占科创板硬科技企业总数的40%。

;

;;【四川发布3255个博士后岗位，科研经费最高达每年700万】;

;

;近日，四川省人力资源和社会保障厅发布2024年在川博士后设站单位博士后招收进站需求信息，共有192家设站单位参与，发布博士后岗位3255个，岗位数量较2022年增长4.7%。

;;【浙江108家企业入围中国民企500强，数量连续25年居首位】;

;;【山东发布安全生产暗访检查新政】;

;

;应急管理部9月13日消息，近日，山东省安全生产委员会印发《山东省安全生产暗访检查制度》，对安全生产暗访检查（以下简称暗访检查）的原则、牵头单位、方式、内容、程序、要求等进行明晰，使暗访检查制度成为一种常态化工作措施。

;

;根据《制度》，暗访检查是指事先不发通知、不打招呼、不听汇报、不用陪同和接待，直奔基层、直插现场，进行突击检查、随机抽查、“回头看”复查的工作方式。暗访检查采取定期和不定期相结合的方式进行，按照日常检查与暗访检查相结合的原则，加大暗访检查频次。

;;【国台办发言人陈斌华：台湾没有资格加入联合国】;

;

;9月13日，国台办举行例行新闻发布会。会上，新任发言人陈斌华就台湾当局近日提出将敦促联合国修正联大2758号决议回答记者提问。陈斌华表示，联合国是由主权国家组成的政府间国际组织，台湾是中国的一部分，不是国家，没有资格加入联合国。

;

;2758号决议系于1971年第26届联合国大会通过。决议决定恢复中华人民共和国在联合国的一切合法权利，明确中华人民共和国政府代表是中国在联合国的唯一合法代表，从而不存在“两个中国”“一中一台”的问题。
